          <item>
    <title>Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Sunday 18 Feb 2018</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/daily-briefing/91723/ten-things-you-need-to-know-today-sunday-18-feb-2018</link>
    <description><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-stories field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Corbyn told to change path on Brexit to save NHS</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Jeremy Corbyn is facing renewed pressure to alter Labour’s position on Brexit after former leader Neil Kinnock backed halting Britain’s EU exit. Speaking to The Observer, Kinnock said: "We should stop Brexit to save the NHS" or at least "mitigate the damage" by staying within the single market. Shadow cabinet members are expected to join calls for the UK to remain in the single market and customs union. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Minister slams &#039;deeply disturbing&#039; state of British jails </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Two-thirds of British prisons are providing inmates with inadequate conditions or unacceptable treatment, an investigation by The Observer has found, with two in five jails deemed to be unacceptably unsafe. Prisons minister Rory Stewart described the condition of some penal institutions as "deeply disturbing" with "increasing levels of violence committed by prisoners, and horrifying rates of self-harm". </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Trump attacks FBI over Florida shooting failings </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Donald Trump has criticised the FBI for missing warning signs for the school shooting in Florida. The US President tweeted that the agency was "spending too much time trying to prove Russian collusion with the Trump campaign". Meanwhile, students who survived the shooting are calling for tighter legislation on gun control and pointing out that the president received financial support from the National Rifle Association during his election campaign. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Emma Watson leads stars signing anti-harassment letter </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The actress Emma Watson has donated £1m to a new campaign aimed at helping those affected by harassment. The Harry Potter star’s donation comes as nearly 200 female British and Irish stars have signed an open letter in The Observer, calling for an end to sexual harassment at work. Emma Thompson and Keira Knightley among the stars to sign the letter. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Human-sheep hybrids could lead to diabetes cure </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The world's first human-sheep hybrids have been created by scientists. In a major step towards growing an unlimited supply of human organs for transplants and providing a cure for Type 1 diabetes, a team at Stanford University successfully grew embryos inside a surrogate which had both sheep and human cells. Britain is currently facing a transplant shortage crisis. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">New Ukip leader believes Islam is a &#039;death cult&#039;</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Ukip members voted yesterday to sack Henry Bolton, who was the party’s fourth leader in 18 months. The move came after controversy over racist messages sent by his partner. Replacing him is new interim leader Gerard Batten, who said last year that non-Muslims should have a "perfectly rational fear" of Islam, which he described as a "death cult". </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Campaign calls for half the planet to be a nature reserve </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> As much as 50% of the planet should be turned into a nature reserve as populations of all kinds of wildlife decline at alarming speed. "That may seem a lot – if you think the world is a just a place for humans to exploit," said Nature Need Half campaigner Harvey Locke. "But if you recognise the world as one that we share with wildlife, letting it have half of the Earth does not seem that much." </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">&#039;Inappropriate&#039; Brendan Cox steps down from charities </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The widower of the murdered MP Jo Cox has quit two charities he set up in her memory after allegations of sexual assault. Although Brendan Cox denies assaulting a woman in her 30s at Harvard University in 2015, he has admitted to "inappropriate" behaviour while working for Save the Children. "I do acknowledge and understand that during my time at Save the Children I made mistakes," he said. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Netanyahu slams Poland over &#039;Jewish perpetrators&#039; claim </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Israel’s prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu has rebuked his Polish counterpart for saying that Jews were among the perpetrators of the Holocaust. Speaking after a new Polish law made it illegal to accuse the Polish nation or state of complicity in Nazi crimes, Morawiecki had said there were "Polish perpetrators - as there were Jewish perpetrators, as there were Russian perpetrators, as there were Ukrainian.... not only German perpetrators".  </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Fire at Tibetan Buddhism&#039;s most important shrine </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> A fire has broken out at the Jokhang Monastery in Lhasa, which is the most important shrine in Tibetan Buddhism. State media in China said the blaze started late on Saturday and was quickly extinguished, with no casualties reported. The Jokhang monastery is more than 1,000 years old and is listed as a Unesco World Heritage Site. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 07:44:33 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Tim Edwards</dc:creator>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Live stream from London: the Burberry February 2018 Show </title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/91722/live-stream-from-london-the-burberry-february-2018-show</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122668" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">

<p class="short-teaser">
Watch Christopher Bailey&#039;s final show for the British heritage brand at London Fashion Week </p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">

  </span><span class="field field-name-field-author field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/author/felix-bischof-0">Felix Bischof</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Saturday, February 17, 2018 - 11:06am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Today's Burberry show at London Fashion Week marks the final collection of Christopher Bailey for the storied British brand. Since joining Burberry in May 2001, following his roles at Donna Karan in New York and Gucci in Milan, Bailey has succesfully branched the once ailing brand into a global luxury house. </p>

<div id="file-122669" class="file file-video file-video-youtube file-content-original">

  <item>
    <title>Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Saturday 17 Feb 2018</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/daily-briefing/91721/ten-things-you-need-to-know-today-saturday-17-feb-2018</link>
    <description><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-stories field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Russians charged over US 2016 election tampering</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Thirteen Russians have been charged with interfering in the US 2016 election in order to help Donald Trump to victory. The charges were made by Special Counsel Robert Mueller. The indictment alleges that the Russians’ operations "included supporting the presidential campaign of then-candidate Donald J Trump" and "disparaging" Hillary Clinton. "The Trump campaign did nothing wrong - no collusion!" tweeted the US President. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Put security ahead of ideology, May will tell EU </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Theresa May will propose a new UK-EU treaty on intelligence and security in a speech today. The PM will argue that the European Union would put its citizens at risk if it allows ideology or rigid institutions to distract its leaders from the need to cooperate against terror threats. "Those who threaten our security would like nothing more than to see us fractured," she will say. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">We didn&#039;t murder babies in cots, says Oxfam chief</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The chief executive of Oxfam says attacks on the charity are "out of proportion to the level of culpability". Speaking to The Guardian about the charity’s sex exploitation scandal in Haiti, Mark Goldring repeated his apology but added: "The intensity and the ferocity of the attack makes you wonder, what did we do? We murdered babies in their cots?" </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Center Parcs pulls Daily Mail ads over column row </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Family holiday firm Center Parcs has pulled its advertising from the Daily Mail after columnist Richard Littlejohn told readers not to consider same-sex parents as "the new normal". Littlejohn’s column followed news that diver Tom Daley and his film-maker husband Dustin Lance Black are expecting their first child. Center Parcs said: "We felt this placement was completely unacceptable and therefore ceased advertising with the Daily Mail with immediate effect." </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Turkey jails journalists over &#039;subliminal&#039; articles </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> A Turkish court has sentenced three prominent journalists to life in prison over allegations of involvement in a 2016 coup attempt. Prosecutors say the journalists sent "subliminal messages" through television appearances and newspaper columns urging the overthrow of the government. "This sets a devastating precedent for scores of other journalists charged with similarly groundless charges," said the writers’ association PEN International. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Palm oil halves Borneo&#039;s orang-utan population </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Borneo’s orang-utan population has fallen by half due to palm oil, hunting and logging. A study found that between 70,000 and 100,000 of the endangered primates remain in the wild on the island. It concluded that the species are "highly likely" to become extinct if current trends continue. Palm oil is used in around half of supermarket products, including peanut butter and cleaning spray. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Embattled Ukip leader likens himself to Diana and Dodi</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The leader of Ukip, Henry Bolton, says the scrutiny of his love life is similar to that faced by Diana, Princess of Wales. "I understand the scrutiny and public interest but it’s been going on for six weeks," he said. "There’s probably been nothing like that since the Profumo affair or Diana and Dodi." The party will hold an extraordinary general meeting today which could result in a vote of no confidence in Bolton. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Afghans file 1.17m allegations of war crimes </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Afghans have submitted 1.17m claims of war crimes to the International Criminal Court in the past three months. Allegations are made against the Taliban and Islamic State, the Afghan Security Forces and government-affiliated warlords, the US-led coalition, and foreign and domestic intelligence agencies. "It is shocking there are so many," said Abdul Wadood Pedram of the Human Rights and Eradication of Violence Organisation. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Parents take kids on record number of term-time breaks </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Record numbers of parents are taking their children on holiday during term-time to grab cheaper packages. A total of 3.65m days were lost in the 2015-16 academic year to holidays that were not authorised by head teachers in England - nearly 500,000 days more than the previous year. During the six-week summer break, family holidays can cost as much as 60% more as travel firms cash in on demand. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Youngsters flee Facebook after parents &#039;killed it&#039;</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> More than three million under-25s in the UK and US will quit Facebook, or stop using it regularly, this year. Why? "As soon as parents got in they killed it," 24-year-old Jordan Ranford tells The Guardian. A 21-year-old adds: "I think Facebook will shut down one day; there will be a new thing soon and no-one will be on it any more". However, Facebook still has billion registered users and the exodus of the young is offset by older users joining. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 07:31:38 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Tim Edwards</dc:creator>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Real Madrid revolution: Neymar, Kane and Pogba in, Zidane and Ronaldo out?</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/football/91720/real-madrid-transfer-news-neymar-kane-pogba-in-zidane-ronaldo-out</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122645" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/real_madrid_transfer_news_champions_league_getty_images_918278062.jpg?itok=v0e7V_PW" alt="Real Madrid transfer news Champions League" title="Real Madrid transfer news Champions League" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr"><span>Could we see a different Real Madrid starting XI next season to the one that faced PSG?</span></p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Gabriel Bouys/AFP/Getty Images   </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Real Madrid transfer news Champions League</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
There could be major changes at Real this summer - we look at the potential Bernabeu transfers</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/in-depth">In Depth</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 4:03pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Real Madrid fans may still be celebrating their 3-1 victory over Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League, but domestically Los Blancos are fourth in La Liga and a massive 19 points behind rivals and leaders Barcelona.</p>
<p><span></p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>Could major changes be about to happen at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium? From a squad overhaul to a change in manager, the world’s football media is rife with speculation about the potential comings and goings at the defending Champions League holders.</span></p>
<p><span>We take a look at the managerial reports, potential transfers and the players who could leave Real Madrid at the end of the season. It could be a very busy summer in the Spanish capital.</span></p>
<h3 dir="ltr"><span>Will Zidane stay on as manager? </span></h3>
<p><span>Even though he has led Real Madrid to successive Champions League titles and the Spanish championship last season, Zinedine Zidane’s future is very much up in the air. </span>Last month Real were humiliated by Leganes after losing 2-1 on aggregate in the Copa del Rey - a result that <a href="http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/01/25/5a69107e22601da1388b463b.html" target="_blank">Marca</a> called “the most ridiculous night of Zidane’s reign”.</p>
<p>Since then Real have hit back with league wins against Valencia (4-1), Real Sociedad (5-2) and a 2-2 draw with Levante. After the Leganes defeat fans were using the #ZidaneOut hashtag on social media, but since the 3-1 win over PSG, <a href="http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/02/16/5a85ae94e5fdeac42d8b4567.html" target="_blank">Marca</a> says that many were “praying for him to stay”. It’s a tough life being a football manager.</p>
<p><span>Zidane says he is not “at all worried about his future” while captain Sergio Ramos believes only the Frenchman knows what he’ll do next season. Ramos said: “He might even win something and still leave.”<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">&#39;He might want a rest&#39;: Ramos hints Zidane is set to leave Real Madrid in the summer even if they win major honours <a href="https://t.co/i0kpWMdeP6">https://t.co/i0kpWMdeP6</a> <a href="https://t.co/TREWknzNbH">pic.twitter.com/TREWknzNbH</a></p>
<p>&mdash; MailOnline Sport (@MailSport) <a href="https://twitter.com/MailSport/status/964427925691887616?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<h3 dir="ltr"><span>Pochettino and Low are linked</span></h3>
<p><span>The uncertainty of Zidane’s future has led to many reports about his potential successor in the Real Madrid hot-seat. Two names to be linked with the job are Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino and Germany manager Joachim Low.</span></p>
<p>Pochettino has impressed at Spurs and <a href="https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/5583201/tottenham-mauricio-pochettino-contract-real-madrid-psg/" target="_blank">The Sun</a> says that the London club look set to offer a big-money deal to keep him in the Premier League. </p>
<p>If Zidane does leave then Real could turn to Germany boss Low. The <a href="https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/674402/Joachim-Low-ready-Zinedine-Zidane-Real-Madrid-news-gossip" target="_blank">Daily Star</a> says Low is “ready to take the reins” at Real and is plotting to bring “superstars” to the Bernabeu. </p>
<h3 dir="ltr"><span>Real Madrid potential transfers in</span></h3>
<p>Whether it’s Zidane, Pochettino or Low in charge, it’s looks very likely that Real Madrid will have a massive squad overhaul in the summer. Yesterday <a href="https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/02/13/real-madrid-tottenham-kane-pochettino-zidane-cordeiro-us-soccer-lagerwey" target="_blank">Sports Illustrated</a> reported that a source had revealed that Real have a €600m (£534m) transfer war chest for the summer. </p>
<p><span>If the reports are true then the Real Madrid strikeforce could look very different next season. We look at the latest transfers news for players who could join Real Madrid. Are we about to see the next era of the Galacticos?</span></p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>David De Gea, goalkeeper</span></h5>
<p>The Manchester United and Spain stopper has been a long-term target for Real. He only has 18 months left on his contract at Manchester United and the <a href="https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/919914/David-De-Gea-Real-Madrid-Transfer-News-Manchester-United-Odds-Rumours-Gossip" target="_blank">Daily Express</a> says that Real are “odds-on” favourites to sign him.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Thibaut Courtois, goalkeeper</span></h5>
<p>The <a href="https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/919914/David-De-Gea-Real-Madrid-Transfer-News-Manchester-United-Odds-Rumours-Gossip" target="_blank">Daily Express</a> also reports that Thibaut Courtois is an “alternative” goalkeeping option. The Chelsea and Belgium number one, who previously played for Atletico Madrid, admitted that his “<a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5359375/Thibaut-Courtois-admits-keen-Real-Madrid-move.html" target="_blank">heart is still in Madrid</a>” as his two children still live in the Spanish capital with his ex-girlfriend.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Toby Alderweireld, defender </span></h5>
<p>Toby Alderweireld’s contract talks with Tottenham are reportedly at a stalemate and this has put a number of clubs on alert. The <a href="https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/real-madrid-eye-transfer-tottenham-12026931" target="_blank">Daily Mirror</a> says that Real and Manchester United lead the chase for Belgian defender.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Real Madrid will make a move for Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba.<br><br>It&#39;s the gossip: <a href="https://t.co/uPeaS2ptGc">https://t.co/uPeaS2ptGc</a> <a href="https://t.co/TznirWxlCo">pic.twitter.com/TznirWxlCo</a></p>
<p>&mdash; BBC Sport (@BBCSport) <a href="https://twitter.com/BBCSport/status/964378817010720768?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><h5 dir="ltr"><span>Paul Pogba, midfielder</span></h5>
<p>He only rejoined Manchester United in 2016 but reports suggest that Paul Pogba has “<a href="/football/91696/paul-pogba-man-utd-transfer-news-real-madrid" target="_blank">some regrets</a>” about moving back to Old Trafford. Real Madrid were also interested in signing Pogba from Juventus and today the <a href="https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/682303/Man-Utd-news-Real-Madrid-Paul-Pogba-transfer-Jose-Mourinho-Zinedine-Zidane-update-rumours" target="_blank">Daily Star</a> reports that the Spanish giants are ready to bid £120m for the French midfielder.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Eden Hazard, midfielder</span></h5>
<p>According to <a href="http://www.mundodeportivo.com/futbol/fichajes/20180215/44804979019/marco-asensio-trueque-real-madrid-eden-hazard-chelsea.html" target="_blank">Mundo Deportivo</a> and reported by <a href="http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/transfer-news-rumours-live-real-madrid-prepare-pogba-bid/ia27i9ejwrkm1wbpytniyg3zy" target="_blank">Goal.com</a>, Real are willing to sell Marco Asensio to Chelsea in an attempt to get Eden Hazard.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Robert Lewandowski, striker</span></h5>
<p>The Polish international has told Bayern Munich that he wants to join Real Madrid, <a href="https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5546524/robert-lewandowski-tells-bayern-munich-he-wants-to-leave-to-join-real-madrid/" target="_blank">The Sun</a> reports. Lewandowski has a “long-time desire” to join Real and reports in Poland suggest his agent will hold departure talks with Bayern.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Harry Kane, striker</span></h5>
<p><a href="https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/02/13/real-madrid-tottenham-kane-pochettino-zidane-cordeiro-us-soccer-lagerwey" target="_blank">Sports Illustrated</a> reported this week that Real Madrid are planning a swoop for Tottenham striker Harry Kane. The England star is one of their top transfer targets but would cost a world-record transfer fee of more than €300m (£267m). The <a href="https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/919572/Cristiano-Ronaldo-Real-Madrid-Tottenham-Harry-Kane-transfer-news-accept" target="_blank">Daily Express</a> says that Cristiano Ronaldo would welcome Kane to the club - as long as the Englishman does not “usurp him as the club’s talisman”.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Marcus Rashford, striker </span></h5>
<p>The <a href="https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/918895/Manchester-United-News-Marcus-Rashford-Real-Madrid-Transfer-Odds-Premier-League-Gossip" target="_blank">Daily Express</a> says that Real Madrid are rated as the “favourites” to sign the Manchester United striker in the summer. The Express claims the Spanish giants are eyeing up Rashford if they are unable to sign Harry Kane.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Insider: Neymar is indeed Real Madrid%u2019s top summer target; club likely won%u2019t stand in way of Ronaldo exit. Dan Flynn about to extend as CEO of US Soccer <a href="https://t.co/vUcmM70mWo">https://t.co/vUcmM70mWo</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Grant Wahl (@GrantWahl) <a href="https://twitter.com/GrantWahl/status/963856142303678466?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 14, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><h3 dir="ltr"><span>The Neymar factor</span></h3>
<p><span>The one player consistently linked with a transfer to Real Madrid is PSG star Neymar. The Brazilian previously played for Real’s biggest rivals Barcelona, but that won’t matter to the Madrid faithful.</span></p>
<p>Despite signing for PSG for £200m last August, <a href="https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5583053/neymar-real-madrid-2019-lionel-messi-cristiano-ronaldo/" target="_blank">The Sun</a> says that Neymar will join Real in 2019. But according to the <a href="http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/real-madrid-neymar-transfer-news-paris-saint-germain-psg-champions-league-preview-a8208831.html" target="_blank">Independent</a>, Real Madrid want Neymar this summer and are confident he will move back to Spain.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/682078/Real-Madrid-transfer-news-Neymar-Paris-St-Germain-Zidane-Ronaldo-Bale-Navas-Modric-Benzema" target="_blank">Daily Star</a> says Real are preparing for one of their “biggest transfer windows ever” and a move for Neymar could involve selling four players to fund the deal. The “elite stars” who could be set to leave Madrid include Keylor Navas, Gareth Bale, Karim Benzema and Luka Modric.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Could the biggest transfer of all time actually happen?!<a href="https://t.co/QeY6cQRjyA">https://t.co/QeY6cQRjyA</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Goal (@goal) <a href="https://twitter.com/goal/status/963696948812439552?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 14, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><h3 dir="ltr"><span>Which players could leave Real Madrid?</span></h3>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Cristiano Ronaldo: linked with Chelsea and Arsenal</span></h5>
<p>After scoring 101 Champions League goals and 633 in total for the club, it seems unbelievable that Cristiano Ronaldo could ever leave Real Madrid. But the <a href="http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/15/jorge-mendes-contacts-arsenal-chelsea-propose-cristiano-ronaldo-transfer-7314632/" target="_blank">Metro</a> reports that the 33-year-old has “grown frustrated with life in Spain recently” and his agent Jorge Mendes has reportedly approached Chelsea and Arsenal over a potential transfer. Chelsea would be more likely, especially if Eden Hazard makes the move the other way, says <a href="https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5442143/cristiano-ronaldo-chelsea-real-madrid-eden-hazard-premier-league/" target="_blank">The Sun</a>. There are also reports that Ronaldo could move to PSG in a swap deal for Neymar.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Isco: linked with Manchester City</span></h5>
<p>According to Don Balon, and reported by <a href="http://www.caughtoffside.com/2018/02/15/man-city-transfer-news-man-utd-rivalled-for-isco-and-kroos/" target="_blank">Caught Offside</a>, Manchester City lead the chase for Real midfielder Isco. City boss Pep Guardiola could also be after Isco’s team-mate Toni Kroos.</p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>Gareth Bale: linked with Manchester United</span></h5>
<p>The Welshman’s agent Jonathan Barnett says he is happy at Madrid, but according to the <a href="https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/682387/Gareth-Bale-Man-Utd-Real-Madrid-Jose-Mourinho-Tottenham-problem-rumours-gossip-news" target="_blank">Daily Star</a> he actually wants to join Manchester United. There is a slight problem for Bale though, <a href="https://www.donbalon.com/noticia/detalle/74257/gareth-bale-esta-calle-florentino-perez-lo-acaba-colocar-cambio-cromos-galactico" target="_blank">Don Balon</a> believe United have no interest in signing the former Tottenham star.  </p>
<p><span> </span> </p>
          </div>

  <item>
    <title>Turkey and US agree to mend ties over Syria</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/91719/turkey-and-us-agree-to-mend-ties-over-syria</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-78556" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/5/56/141022-pod_0.jpg?itok=JYt9fc_X" alt="Kurds at Syria/Turkey border" title="Kurds at Syria/Turkey border" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> On a hill near the Turkish-Syrian border, Kurds watch US-led air strikes against Islamic State militants. Kurdish fighters in Kobane continue to fight IS on the ground. </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Gokhan Sahin/Getty </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Kurds at Syria/Turkey border</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Sparring nations discuss possible joint deployment in northern region of war-torn country</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 3:59pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> <span>The US and Turkey have reached an agreement to defuse the crisis in northern Syria, with Turkey proposing a joint deployment in the region if a US-backed Kurdish militia leaves a border area.</span></p>
<p><span></p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>Turkey had threatened to attack US-allied Kurdish forces in Manbij, regarding them as terrorists, the </span><a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-43084963" target="_blank"><span>BBC</span></a><span> reports. Pro-Turkish forces are battling the militia in nearby Afrin, across Turkey’s southern border with Syria.</span></p>
<p><span>The US has “armed, trained and aided Kurdish fighters with air support and special forces, as the main ground force in its campaign against Islamic State,” says Reuters.</span></p>
<p><span>But the Turkish government views the Kurdish fighters as an “extension of the outlawed Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK), which has fought a decades-long war against Ankara,” says </span><a href="http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/02/turkey-mend-ties-syria-tension-grows-180215173013622.html" target="_blank"><span>Al-Jazeera</span></a><span>.</span></p>
<p><span>US Secretary of State Rex Tillerson met Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan during a two-day visit that followed weeks of escalating anti-American rhetoric from the Turkish government.</span></p>
<p><span>“We’re going to act together from this point forward. We’re going to lock arms. We’re going to work through the issues that are causing difficulties for us and we’re going to resolve them,” Tillerson told a news conference after a meeting with Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu. </span></p>
<p><span> </span> </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/usa">USA</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/turkey">Turkey</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/syria">Syria</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Toyota Supra 2018: everything we know so far</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/geneva-motor-show/91718/toyota-supra-2018-everything-we-know-so-far</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122654" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/dv1idacwkaemfwu.jpg-large.jpeg?itok=Cxo56GJd" alt="Toyota Supra" title="Toyota Supra" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The new Supra appears at the Geneva Motor Show next month  </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Toyota</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Toyota Supra</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Front-engined sports car will be based on the upcoming BMW Z4</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/in-depth">In Depth</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 3:20pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> <span>Fans of the iconic Toyota Supra have been waiting 16 years for the Japanese carmaker to launch a new fifth-generation version of the front-engined sports car. </span></p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>Now the wait is almost over. An all-new vehicle bearing the Supra name will make its public debut at the <a href="/geneva-motor-show/91304/geneva-motor-show-2018-preview-what-new-cars-to-expect">Geneva Motor Show</a>, which runs from 8 to 18 March.</p>
<p><span>Information about the highly-anticipated car is scarce as Toyota has only launched a shadowy preview image. </span></p>
<p>But <a href="https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/motor-shows-geneva-motor-show/2019-toyota-supra-statistics-leaked-1496kg-335bhp-0-62mph" target="_blank">Autocar</a> says the Supra will be built on the same carbon fibre architecture as the upcoming BMW Z4 and share much of its design with the Toyota FT-1, a concept that first appeared at the 2014 Detroit Motor Show.</p>
<p><span>All will be revealed when the wraps come off in Geneva next month. In the meantime, here’s all the latest news and rumours on the all-new Supra: </span></p>
<h5><span>Price and release</span></h5>
<p>Toyota has yet to officially reveal the new Supra. Details about pricing and a specific release date are expected when the car appears in Geneva.</p>
<p>The US-based magazine <a href="https://www.caranddriver.com/features/2018-toyota-sports-car-feature" target="_blank">Car &amp; Driver</a> says the sports car could enter at around $40,000 (£29,000), which should make it slightly cheaper than the Z4 it’s based on. It’s expected to go on sale either at the end of this year or in early 2019. </p>
<h5><span>Design</span></h5>
<p><span>Toyota has kept the design of the new Supra under wraps. Even the carmaker’s development mules, which are frequently spotted testing on the 12.9-mile Nurburgring race track in Germany, sport heavy camouflage designed to hide much of the car’s styling. </span></p>
<p>But leaked images published in the Japanese magazine Best Car and posted on the fan site <a href="https://www.supramkv.com/threads/mkv-toyota-supra-dimensions-specs-leaked-in-best-car-magazine.737/page-3" target="_blank">SupraMkV.com</a> reportedly reveal the production model’s final form. </p>
<p><span>If the leak is true, the Supra will have a design that resembles the company’s four-year-old FT-1 concept car. The production car’s duck-tail spoiler, sculpted roof and carbon fibre side skirts will all be inspired by the FT-1. </span></p>
<p><span>What separates the Supra from the concept car is its striking front bumper, which features multiple winglets arranged in a similar fashion to the Ferrari's 488 supercar. There are also small vents in front of the rear wheels, which could be used for cooling the brakes. </span></p>
<h5><span>Performance</span></h5>
<p>Under the Supra’s bonnet sits a 3.0-litre turbocharged straight-six engine, <a href="http://www.autoexpress.co.uk/toyota/88119/new-toyota-supra-set-to-debut-at-geneva-2018-in-four-states-of-tune" target="_blank">Auto Express</a> reports, which produces 330bhp and 332lb-ft of torque. </p>
<p><span>Power is sent to the rear axle through an eight-speed automatic gearbox, helping the front-engined sports car go from 0-62mph in 3.8secs, the magazine says. </span></p>
<p>As the Toyota is based on the forthcoming BMW Z4, Autocar says both the engine and transmission are derived from the German car. </p>
<p>According to <a href="http://www.evo.co.uk/toyota/toyota-supra/13960/new-toyota-supra-specifications-leaked-will-hit-62mph-in-38secs" target="_blank">Evo</a>, Toyota will offer four editions of the Supra, all with “varying levels” of performance capability. The range-topping model bears the GRMN name, which the company recently gave to its rally-inspired Yaris hot hatchback, but there’s no word yet on performance figures.  </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/toyota">Toyota</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>The UK's best pasta restaurants</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/91716/the-uks-best-pasta-restaurants</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122653" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/dscf7300.jpg?itok=78gpSS5w" alt="" />  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
In need of an Italian fix? These eateries promise to hit the spot</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 3:15pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <h5>Pasta Loco, Bristol</h5>
<p>Cousins Ben Harvey and Dominic Borel drew on their Italian heritage when setting up this buzzing restaurant on Bristol's Cotham Hill. All pasta is made daily on site, transformed into recipes such as pappardelle served with a rich wild boar ragu and simple and satisfying bucatini with cream, black pepper and gorgonzola. Keep an eye out later this year as the duo open a second location in the city dedicated to ravioli.</p>
<p><em>37a Cotham Hill, Bristol; <a href="http://pastaloco.co.uk" target="_blank">pastaloco.co.uk</a></em></p>
<h5>
<div id="file-122649" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-content-original">
<div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/2018/02/004_tagliatelle_sausage_ragu_001.jpg" alt="" />  </div>
</div>
</h5>
<h5>Padella, London</h5>
<p>Padella is one of the best value dinners to be found in the capital – if you can get a table, that is. The tiny, no reservations restaurant attracts daily queues down Southwark Street, but its pasta, made fresh before your eyes, is more than worth the wait. Pull up a chair at the bar and indulge in a plate, or three, from the reassuringly succinct menu. While many of the dishes change daily, popular items such as the pici cacio e pepe are regular features.</p>
<p><em>6 Southwark Street, London, SE1 1TQ; <a href="https://www.padella.co" target="_blank">padella.co</a></em></p>
<h5>Caldesi in Campagna, Bray</h5>
<p>Nestled in foodie mecca Bray is this unassuming Italian gem turning out top-notch food inspired by chef-patron Giancarlo Caldesi's Tuscan upbringing. After dining on dishes such as duck vincisgrassi (a lasagne-style dish) with mushroom and buffalo mozzarella or pappardelle with melt-in-the-mouth slow-cooked Tuscan beef and veal ragu, sign up to one of the cookery courses to try your hand at making it yourself. Here you can learn to make a range of different pasta types with seasonal sauces to match, or learn more about making gluten-free variations.</p>
<p><em>Old Mill Lane, Bray, Maidenhead, SL6 2BG; <a href="http://caldesi.com" target="_blank">caldesi.com</a></em></p>
<p><em><br />
<div id="file-122650" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-content-original">
<div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/2018/02/dscf7350.jpg" alt="" />  </div>
</div>
<p></em></p>
<h5>Lina Stores, London</h5>
<p>The pasta at this long-standing Italian delicatessen is so legendary that later this spring it will open a separate restaurant down the road dedicated to the food. For now, the institution will continue to serve up fine Italian fare to in-the-know Londoners from the original central Soho location. It has been making fresh pasta on site, specialising in stuffed varieties, since it opened in 1944, with the recipes passed down from generation to generation. Sit outside and enjoy a plateful, or take a handful away to cook at home.</p>
<p><em>18 Brewer Street, London, W1F 0SH; <a href="https://www.linastores.co.uk" target="_blank">linastores.co.uk</a></em></p>
<div id="file-122651" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-content-original">
<div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/2018/02/alessio-1.jpg" alt="" />  </div>
</div>
<h5>Lanterna Ristorante, Scarborough</h5>
<p>Enigmatic chef-patron Giorgio Alessio has headed up local favourite La Lanterna Ristorante for more than two decades, even earning it the accolade of "the English temple of Italian cuisine" from Italian newspaper La Stampa. Drawing on his Piedmont origins, the menu is built around making the most out of the northern Italian region's best ingredients, particularly its prized white truffles.</p>
<p><em>33 Queen Street, Scarborough, North Yorkshire, YO11 1HQ; <a href="http://www.lanterna-ristorante.co.uk" target="_blank">lanterna-ristorante.co.uk</a></em><br />
<div id="file-122652" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-content-original">
<div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/2018/02/hh-lw-r-amy-murrell-2016-135.jpg" alt="" />  </div>
</div>
<h5>Hartnett Holder &amp; Co, Hampshire</h5>
<p>Angela Hartnett's love of cooking was instilled in her at a young age by her mother and Italian grandmother, and today she serves up a refined take on the country's cuisine at her restaurants across the UK. At this culinary destination in the New Forest, she serves up a relaxed, family-style approach to food focused around seasonal ingredients and local produce. Get the full experience and share a meal around the large communal table, centred in the heart of the working kitchen, or sign up to the cookery school to make your own pasta from scratch.</p>
<p><em>Image by Amy Murrell; Lime Wood, Beaulieu Road, Lyndhurst, Hampshire SO43 7FZ; <a href="https://www.limewoodhotel.co.uk" target="_blank">limewoodhotel.co.uk</a></em></p>
<h5>Radici, London</h5>
<p>Hailing from southern Italy, Francesco Mazzei has long championed Calabrian cuisine in the UK, seen across his restaurants in the capital including Sartoria and Fiume. Radici, just off Islington's Upper Street, is no exception. The name translates as 'roots', with this trattoria serving up traditional and hearty fare such as taglierini with fagioli – a comforting dish of pasta and beans­ – and seafood fettuccine.</p>
<p><em>30 Almeida Street, London, N1 1AD; <a href="http://www.radici.uk" target="_blank">radici.uk</a></em> </p>
          </div>
      </div></description>

 <dc:creator>Show Media</dc:creator>

  <item>
    <title>Courtesan restaurant review: a modern dim sum diner with an all-female drinks list</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/91715/courtesan-restaurant-review-a-modern-dim-sum-diner-with-an-all-female-drinks-list</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122644" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/courtesan-restaurant.jpg?itok=eqfNHuTF" alt="" />  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
The UK’s first restaurant to feature drinks exclusively produced or grown by women</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/review">Review</a></span>
  </span><span class="field field-name-field-author field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even">Stina Sanders</span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 8:14am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Take a short walk down Atlantic Road and you will find Courtesan, a modern dim sum restaurant, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Brixton Market.</p>
<p>Step into the red painted former shop and you are instantly greeted with antique bird cages and an interior of dark wood and dim lighting, which feels like being transported directly into Hong Kong’s famously vibrant Bird Market.</p>
<p>At the bar, the staff greet guests with a friendly smile and a drink recommendation. Our Elderflower and Cucumber Collins goes down rather too easily and before we know it, we are on our second.</p>
<p>Between shaking up cocktails, the barman will explain how Courtesan became the UK’s first restaurant to feature drinks exclusively produced or grown by women. This unique selling point, as well as the venue’s feminine aesthetic, support the restaurant’s inspiration, which draws on the courtesans of ancient China.</p>
<p>As well as the exotic cocktail list, the all-female kitchen team has created an innovative dim sum menu, which focuses heavily on pure, MSG and preservative-free ingredients, while providing extensive vegan, vegetarian and gluten-free options.</p>
<p>My friend arrives and we quickly order a mixture of dim sum, noodle dishes, Bao buns and rice dishes.</p>
<p>The plates arrive as they are ready, rather than all at the same time, a laid-back approach common to many UK restaurants these days. Some may disagree with the approach, but here it provides us with room to take our time catching up, and enjoy our food – especially the delicious pumpkin-spiced bao. The creamy verdant mezzelune, king prawn and bean curd Cheung Fun, and the tempura frog legs are other highlights. All three are consumed in near silence – a testament to their near perfection. </p>
<p>When summer arrives, Courtesan will be introducing an entertainment programme in its late-night entertainment space, with a variety of residencies and one-off performances. Expect burlesque and cabaret acts, live jazz music, DJs, and even the odd West End star.</p>
<p>Whether it’s for a quick bite and a post-work cocktail, or feasting with friends and taking in a show, or even dancing the night away, Courtesan is the perfect one-stop shop for Brixton locals and tourists from around the capital alike.</p>
<p><em>Courtesan, 69-73 Atlantic Road, Brixton, <a href="http://thecourtesan.co.uk/">thecourtesan.co.uk</a>, <a class="fl r-igvRlu53PVKM" href="https://www.google.co.uk/search?ei=0-SGWsiFGcXSgAaFzaewAg&amp;q=courtesan+restaurrant+phone&amp;oq=courtesan+restaurrant+phone&amp;gs_l=psy-ab.3..33i160k1.14825.15224.0.15359.5.5.0.0.0.0.107.425.3j2.5.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.4.346...33i21k1.0.4L3xQ5HTGus#" data-number="+442081278677" data-pstn-out-call-url="" title="Call via Hangouts" jsaction="r.oVdbr2mIpA8" data-rtid="igvRlu53PVKM" jsl="$t t-6xg4lalHw8M;$x 0;" data-ved="0ahUKEwjG_OGQzarZAhUJL8AKHcXpBj8QkAgILigAMAA">020 8127 8677</a></em> </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/restaurant-reviews">Restaurant reviews</a></div>    </div></div></description>

 <dc:creator>Arion</dc:creator>

  <item>
    <title>Scottish FA in ‘dark ages’ after appointing Alex McLeish</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/football/91713/alex-mcleish-scotland-manager-sfa-fan-reaction</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122634" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/alex_mcleish_scotland_manager_sfa_fan_reaction_getty_images_918961040.jpg?itok=3AAl8BW_" alt="Alex McLeish Scotland manager SFA fan reaction" title="Alex McLeish Scotland manager SFA fan reaction" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr"><span>New Scotland manager Alex McLeish was unveiled at Hampden Park</span></p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Mark Runnacles/Getty Images   </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Alex McLeish Scotland manager SFA fan reaction</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Not all fans and pundits are pleased that the 59-year-old has returned as Scotland boss</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/in-depth">In Depth</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 1:46pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Alex McLeish has been appointed as Scotland manager for a second time after signing a contract until 2020. </p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>McLeish, who will replace Gordon Strachan, returns to the role 11 years after leaving for Birmingham City. The <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43079576" target="_blank">BBC</a> says he was the Scottish FA’s “unanimous choice” despite <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42778105" target="_blank">Northern Ireland boss Michael O’Neill</a> turning down the job last month.   </p>
<p><span>McLeish’s first game in charge will be a friendly against Costa Rica on 23 March at Hampden Park. His first competitive match is against Albania at home in the Uefa Nations League on 10 September.</span></p>
<p>As a player McLeish won 77 caps for Scotland and says it’s a “tremendous honour” to manage his country again. In a <a href="https://www.scottishfa.co.uk/news/alex-mcleish-appointed-scotland-national-team-head-coach/?rid=14258" target="_blank">statement</a> McLeish said: “I am incredibly fortunate to have had the chance to lead my country already and I am immensely proud to be in this position for a second time. </p>
<p><span>“There is much to be positive about in Scottish football, with players playing at the highest level and promising talent breaking through.</span></p>
<p><span>“With Hampden Park as one of the host venues for Euro 2020 we have an amazing opportunity to showcase our talents to the world from our own backyard. I am relishing the challenge of leading us to a major tournament and I cannot wait to get started.”<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Alex McLeish has a long history with Scotland, both as a player and a manager. %uD83C%uDFF4%uDB40%uDC67%uDB40%uDC62%uDB40%uDC73%uDB40%uDC63%uDB40%uDC74%uDB40%uDC7F <a href="https://t.co/8iJmqqaF7e">pic.twitter.com/8iJmqqaF7e</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Scottish FA (@ScottishFA) <a href="https://twitter.com/ScottishFA/status/964466603923558400?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>An ‘exemplary candidate’</span></h5>
<p><span>Scottish FA (SFA) president Alan McRae added that it was rare to be able to appoint someone with McLeish’s track record, describing him as an “exemplary candidate”. “Alex McLeish is a true Scotland legend and a natural leader who has enjoyed success at club level in Scotland and England and at international level,” he said.</span> “It is a rarity to be in a position to appoint someone who has experience of successfully managing their country and we are delighted to reach an agreement with Alex.”</p>
<p><span>During the recruitment process, McLeish received “resounding endorsements” from influential figures in the game and this helped establish him as an “outstanding choice” from a strong list of candidates, said McRae.</span></p>
<p><span>He added: “Alex has demonstrated a desire and ability to get results with the national team and we believe that he is best placed to inspire our talented group of players to glory. With Hampden Park hosting matches at UEFA Euro 2020 it is more important than ever before for Scotland to qualify for a tournament finals and we believe that Alex is the exemplary candidate to guide us there.”<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">REACTION<br>&quot;I&#39;ll be totally supportive, but this committee and this SFA, they are way in the dark ages&quot;- Charlie Nicholas on Scotland appointment of Alex McLeish: <a href="https://t.co/stkafFaNtI">https://t.co/stkafFaNtI</a> <a href="https://t.co/FQkGmgICZd">pic.twitter.com/FQkGmgICZd</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Sky Sports Scotland (@ScotlandSky) <a href="https://twitter.com/ScotlandSky/status/964443851493650432?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>What the pundits think</span></h5>
<p><span>While McRae was delighted to name McLeish as Strachan’s successor, former Scotland striker Charlie Nicholas criticised the SFA appointment.</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12017/11252052/alex-mcleish-appointment-shows-scottish-fa-in-dark-ages-says-charlie-nicholas" target="_blank">Sky Sports</a> pundit Nicholas said: “Alex – as much as I like him a lot – wasn’t my first choice. I think they should go for someone younger and the most important ingredient is to start building something for the future.</p>
<p><span>“Dare I say it, [it’s] a little bit like the way England have gone with Gareth Southgate. But I have no problem with Alex being in charge, I’ll be totally supportive, but this committee and this SFA, they are way in the dark ages.</span></p>
<p><span>“It’s time that this whole thing was restructured and re-done. I hope what Alex McLeish brings to the table is to sit down with Malky Mackay – people like Derek McInnes, Steve Clarke – all of the Scottish coaches and say it’s time for change at the top of Scottish international football.”</span> </p>
<p>Ex-Hearts and Hibs player Michael Stewart believes that the appointment of McLeish is a “desperate” one by the SFA. Writing on <a href="https://twitter.com/mstewart_23" target="_blank">Twitter</a>, Stewart said: “The appointment of Alex McLeish, who I admire and have a lot of time for, strikes me as a desperate one by an organisation on its knees lacking any clarity, leadership or vision of what it wants or needs to do.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">The appointment of Alex McLeish, who I admire and have a lot of time for, strikes me as a desperate one by an organisation on its knees lacking any clarity, leadership or vision of what it wants or needs to do.</p>
<p>&mdash; Michael Stewart (@mstewart_23) <a href="https://twitter.com/mstewart_23/status/964272770531188736?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>
<span>“The fact it is doing this at a time when they haven’t a CEO is alarming, but even those still left at Hampden must surely have some awareness this is the wrong course of action at the wrong time. This whole situation is of the SFA own making. Firing the gun without any serious strategic plan in place is a dereliction of duty and they’ve been culpable of this on a grand scale here.”</span></p>
<p>Meanwhile, Stoke City midfielder <a href="https://twitter.com/Charlie26Adam/status/964211192062345216" target="_blank">Charlie Adam</a> said he was “delighted” to see Mcleish get another chance to manage Scotland. And former Scotland striker Kevin Gallacher believes McLeish has “unfinished business” with the national team.</p>
<p>Gallacher told <a href="http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12017/11252052/alex-mcleish-appointment-shows-scottish-fa-in-dark-ages-says-charlie-nicholas" target="_blank">Sky Sports</a>: “His experience is going to be very key, he’s been there before, he’s done the job, it’s not like he’s new to international management, he understands it. </p>
<p><span>“From that point of view, he’s going to go there and hopefully, from the experience he had from his short spell before, he can lift the nation and lift the players up to start getting results for the next campaign.”</span></p>
<h5 dir="ltr"><span>How the Tartan Army reacted</span></h5>
<p><span>Scotland fans have had their say on the news. Here’s a selection of the best comments on Twitter:</span></p>
<p><span>“Make us proud”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Go on bigman make us all feel proud to be Scottish</p>
<p>&mdash; Brian allan (@Brianal31351612) <a href="https://twitter.com/Brianal31351612/status/964462637860966400?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>“Scotland forever”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Good luck Eck, happy enough with this. ALBA GU BRAITH</p>
<p>&mdash; The Kaiser (@GraniteKaiser) <a href="https://twitter.com/GraniteKaiser/status/964469513847746560?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>“A backwards step”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">a backwards organisation taking a backwards step</p>
<p>&mdash; COYBIG (@Hooped1888) <a href="https://twitter.com/Hooped1888/status/964461662114865152?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>“He’s walked out on his country before”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Terrible appointment of a man that%u2019s walked out on his country before.</p>
<p>&mdash; Chic Gibson (@chicgibson) <a href="https://twitter.com/chicgibson/status/964464887014375424?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>Predicting the future?<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">The inevitable - %u201CAfter missing out on the 2022 World Cup qualification play offs, due to a shock draw away in Estonia, Alex McLeish is expected to step down as Scotland Manager in the next few days.%u201D</p>
<p>&mdash; Ryan Crombie (@Ryan_Crombie) <a href="https://twitter.com/Ryan_Crombie/status/964195615587602433?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>Singer Amy Macdonald supports the new boss.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">I%u2019d rather have someone desperate to do the job than have to beg someone who%u2019s not interested! Good luck to Alex McLeish! %uD83C%uDFF4%uDB40%uDC67%uDB40%uDC62%uDB40%uDC73%uDB40%uDC63%uDB40%uDC74%uDB40%uDC7F %uD83D%uDC99</p>
<p>&mdash; Amy Macdonald (@Amy__Macdonald) <a href="https://twitter.com/Amy__Macdonald/status/964227383237709825?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>“Not my third choice”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">As for Alex McLeish, my boat is not floating. He&#39;s a great guy and I would love him to be a success...but he wouldn&#39;t have been my third choice.</p>
<p>&mdash; Neil Cameron (@NeilCameron5) <a href="https://twitter.com/NeilCameron5/status/964167368552386560?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>Damn autocorrect…<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Hate when autocorrect turns %u2018Forward-thinking managerial appointment to give long-suffering Scotland fans a sense of optimism%u2019 into %u2018Alex Mcleish%u2019</p>
<p>&mdash; Oldfirmfacts (@Oldfirmfacts1) <a href="https://twitter.com/Oldfirmfacts1/status/964195476244443136?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span><span>Even the bookies were critical.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Alex McLeish  is the new Scotland manager.<br><br>&quot;We went through a rigorous process,&quot; said a spokesman for the SFA. &quot;We spoke to Michael O&#39;Neill, Malky Mackay, the Krankies &amp; that woman who calls her kids disgusting for not flushing the toilet, but Alex was always our first choice.&quot;</p>
<p>&mdash; Paddy Power (@paddypower) <a href="https://twitter.com/paddypower/status/964434175221616641?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Scotland announce their absence from Euro 2020 by appointing Alex McLeish as their new manager <a href="https://t.co/F9ZUUnLw5w">pic.twitter.com/F9ZUUnLw5w</a></p>
<p>&mdash; ODDSbible (@ODDSbible) <a href="https://twitter.com/ODDSbible/status/964212496390336512?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></span></p>
