  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Paul Pogba ‘regrets’ moving back to Manchester United</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/football/91696/paul-pogba-man-utd-transfer-news-real-madrid</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122603" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/paul_pogba_manchester_united_transfer_news_real_madrid_getty_images_900311626.jpg?itok=oEb7yxww" alt="Paul Pogba Manchester United transfer news Real Madrid" title="Paul Pogba Manchester United transfer news Real Madrid" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr"><span>Paul Pogba rejoined Manchester United in a £89.3m transfer from Juventus in 2016</span></p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Jan Kruger/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Paul Pogba Manchester United transfer news Real Madrid</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Real Madrid could launch aud­acious bid for the French midfielder</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 9:02am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> There’s sensational news in the <a href="https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/682186/Man-Utd-Paul-Pogba-Jose-Mourinho-Mauro-Icardi-Real-Madrid-Alexis-Sanchez-Premier-League" target="_blank">Daily Star</a> today, which claims that Paul Pogba harbours “some regrets” about rejoining Manchester United. </p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>The paper takes its astonishing allegation from the pages of the French sports daily, <a href="https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Article/Manchester-united-paul-pogba-en-plein-spleen/875890" target="_blank">L’Equipe</a>, which says that the French playmaker is having “second thoughts” about his decision to re-sign for the club he left in 2012. </p>
<p><span>Pogba subsequently flourished at Juventus but things haven’t gone so well at Old Trafford since his second coming in 2016. The arrival of Alexis Sanchez has also cast doubt on his United future. </span></p>
<p>Pogba, who has yet to complete 90 minutes since the arrival of Sanchez from Arsenal last month, has reportedly “demanded” Jose Mourinho <a href="/premier-league/91666/premier-league-transfer-news-tottenham-pochettino-wilshere-juventus" target="_blank">alters his formation</a> to give him “more freedom” but given the United manager’s temperament that request seems unlikely to be granted. </p>
<p><span>The 24-year-old Pogba is seen by Mourinho as a box-to-box midfielder but the Star says that he wants to play on the left of a midfield three, “giving him licence to drive forward and attack”.</span></p>
<p><span>The stand-off has allegedly led Pogba to ruminate on his decision to join United rather than Real Madrid for whom he has “never hidden his initial attraction”.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Paul Pogba to Real Madrid?<br><br>The Man Utd midfielder dominates today&#39;s back pages.<br><br>It&#39;s the gossip: <a href="https://t.co/uPeaS2ptGc">https://t.co/uPeaS2ptGc</a> <a href="https://t.co/YizeUF699J">pic.twitter.com/YizeUF699J</a></p>
<p>&mdash; BBC Sport (@BBCSport) <a href="https://twitter.com/BBCSport/status/964409765970395136?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>Where that leaves Pogba at Old Trafford is unclear but with Real Madrid expected to overhaul their squad in the summer after a fitful season, speculation is growing they could make a move for the Gallic playmaker. </span></p>
<p>According to <a href="https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5590517/real-madrid-ready-summer-move-for-paul-pogba-but-will-need-to-offer-over-120million-for-manchester-united-star/" target="_blank">The Sun</a>, “Bernabeu bosses are now plotting an aud­acious bid for Pogba when the season ends”, one that will involve a bid of more than £120m. </p>
<p><span>Might United use the money to lure Mauro Icardi from Inter Milan? The Star claims that super agent Mino Raiola is “attempting to engineer” the transfer. Intriguingly he is also the representative of Pogba.</span></p>
<p><span>Icardi was linked with a move away from the San Siro during last month’s transfer window, with Real said to be interested, but it may be that Raiola could pull off a deal that sees the Argentine move to Old Trafford with Pogba heading to Spain.</span></p>
<p><span> </span> </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/sport">Sport</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/man-utd">Man Utd</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/premier-league">Premier League</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/man-utd-transfer-news">Man Utd transfer news</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/paul-pogba">Paul Pogba</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Europa League: Arsenal take control of tie against Ostersunds FK</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/europa-league/91695/europa-league-arsenal-take-control-of-tie-against-ostersunds-fk</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-122602" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2018/02/mesut_ozil_arsenal_europa_league_ostersunds_fk_getty_images_918701926.jpg?itok=tzB62ReG" alt="Mesut Ozil Arsenal Europa League Ostersunds FK" title="Mesut Ozil Arsenal Europa League Ostersunds FK" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr"><span>Mesut Ozil scored Arsenal’s third goal against </span><span>Ostersunds FK in the Europa League</span></p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Robert Heniksson/AFP/Getty Images   </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Mesut Ozil Arsenal Europa League Ostersunds FK</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Gunners ‘adapted well’ says boss Arsene Wenger after 3-0 victory in Sweden</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/match-report">Match Report</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, February 16, 2018 - 8:38am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <h5 dir="ltr">Ostersunds FK 0 Arsenal 3</h5>
<p><span>When Mesut Ozil signed for Arsenal in 2013 he probably didn’t envisage playing Thursday night football in Ostersund, the 22nd most populous city in Sweden.</span></p>
<p><span></p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league/91626/premier-league-transfer-news-harry-kane-real-madrid-wenger-alderweireld">Real Madrid target Harry Kane as part of £500m spending spree</a></div>    </div></div><p>He would have had in mind glamorous Champions League ties in Barcelona, Milan or Munich but such has been Arsenal’s steady decline in recent seasons that the German midfielder spent last night entertaining 9,165 fans at the Ostersund Arena on an artificial pitch in sub-zero temperatures.</span></p>
<p><span>For a World Cup winner, this is as bad as it gets. To his credit, Ozil put in a dominant display against the Swedes, controlling the midfield and adding Arsenal’s third goal after Nacho Monreal – and an own goal – gave the visitors a 2-0 half-time lead. The hosts fluffed a chance to get on the scoresheet late on when Tom Pettersson missed a penalty.</span></p>
<p><span>Arsene Wenger fielded a strong side for the Europa League last-32 clash, aware that the competition offers the Gunners the only realistic opportunity of qualifying for next season’s Champions League. </span></p>
<p><span>Eight points adrift of the top four places in the Premier League, Arsenal have to win Europe’s secondary competition if they want to qualify for the showpiece tournament.</span></p>
<p><span>“I think we adapted quite well to the [artificial] pitch,” said Wenger. “They were maybe a bit cautious at the start and we took advantage of it and took control of the game once we opened the scoring.”<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Convincing win for us %u26BD%uD83D%uDC4D%uD83C%uDFFC  Going with a 3-0 lead into the 2nd leg! %uD83D%uDCAA%uD83C%uDFFC%uD83D%uDD34 <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/YaGunnersYa?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#YaGunnersYa</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/UEL?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#UEL</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/Arsenal?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@arsenal</a> <a href="https://t.co/lgcESEIHAy">pic.twitter.com/lgcESEIHAy</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Mesut Ozil (@MesutOzil1088) <a href="https://twitter.com/MesutOzil1088/status/964243668432576512?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></p>
<p><span>With Arsenal already out of the FA Cup, they have this weekend off, allowing the squad to rest and Wenger to contemplate his starting XI for the second leg at the Emirates next Thursday. </span></p>
<p><span>“I don’t think I will rest [players], I will try to win the game again,” said Wenger. “Maybe rotate, play the players who didn’t play and rest one or two who played.”</span></p>
<p><span>The Frenchman will have been relieved that his squad came through the fixture unscathed, but while the likes of Ozil, Mohamed Elneny and Henrikh Mkhitaryan impressed, the manager won’t have drawn much satisfaction from the performance of Danny Welbeck.</span></p>
<p><span>The former England striker made a rare start in the absence of the cup-tied Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and the injured Alexandre Lacazette but Welbeck struggled to find any rhythm on the artificial pitch. </span></p>
<p><span>“The pitch was a bit hard and we knew coming here that it was going to be a bit difficult,” said Welbeck. “Obviously with it being a 4G pitch and having had so many injuries in the past I made sure I did my rehab really well. You hear stories about the dangers of playing on 4G pitches after knee injuries but I did my warm-up and I was alright.”</span></p>
<p><span><span id="docs-internal-guid-b941898a-9db9-1333-c201-592c8f3de269"><span>In the other first-leg matches, Celtic beat Zenit St Petersburg 1-0 thanks to a superb goal by Callum McGregor. Napoli lost 3-1 at home to RB Leipzig while AC Milan won 3-0 away at Ludogorets Razgrad. Borussia Dortmund’s Michy Batshuayi netted a brace as the Bundesliga side came back from 2-1 down to beat Atalanta 3-2.<br />
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">CELTIC PARK ERUPTS!!!<br><br>Callum McGregor with a superb finish but what an assist from Charly Musonda!<br><br>The Notorious Callum McGregor %uD83C%uDF40 <a href="https://t.co/PGNFqjIk2b">pic.twitter.com/PGNFqjIk2b</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) <a href="https://twitter.com/btsportfootball/status/964254118624686080?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 15, 2018</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p></span></span></span></p>

  <item>
    <title>Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Friday 16 Feb 2018</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/daily-briefing/91694/ten-things-you-need-to-know-today-friday-16-feb-2018</link>
    <description><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-stories field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">‘Remorseful’ school shooting suspect visited McDonald’s</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The 19-year-old believed to be behind the murders of 17 pupils and teachers at a Florida high school on Wednesday is “remorseful” and a “broken human being”, his lawyer has said. Police say Nikolas Cruz, previously expelled from the school, has admitted carrying out the shooting. He is said to have joined a white supremacist group. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Clubs have questions to answer over Barry Bennell</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Former youth coach Barry Bennell, now believed to be the worst child sex offender known in football, will be sentenced for another 50 offences on Monday, after being convicted yesterday. But some survivors and commentators say football clubs have serious questions to answer because it emerged in the trial that they were warned. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Mid-earners unable to afford to buy homes</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The Institute for Fiscal Studies says mid-earners – defined as individuals or couples taking home between £22,200 and £30,600 – aged 25 to 34 are the group most hit by increasing house prices. Over the past 20 years, home ownership among that group has dropped from 65% to just 27%. The biggest fall has been in south-east England. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Team GB wins first medal at Winter Olympics</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Team GB has taken its first medal at the Winter Olympics in South Korea. Dom Parsons produced the “performance of his career”, says The Guardian, to win bronze in the men’s skeleton after a mistake by Martins Dukurs, who had been ahead of him. Parsons, who is ranked 12th in the world, won his bronze by a 0.11-second margin. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Report calls for £10,000 basic income for all</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The Royal Society for the encouragement of the Arts, Manufactures and Commerce (RSA) wants the Government to introduce a Universal Basic Income (UBI) of £10,000 a year for everyone. Payments would not be means tested, though people would have to demonstrate how they planned to use the money. State benefits would be cut. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Japan grants asylum to just 20 of 20,000 applicants</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> New figures show Japan accepted just 20 asylum seekers last year, despite receiving a record 19,628 applications, prompting accusations the country is unfairly ignoring those in need. The authorities say a huge number of bogus applications are now being received after the law was changed to allow asylum seekers to work. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Council proposes feeding children during holidays</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> North Lanarkshire council, in central Scotland, wants to tackle “weekend and holiday hunger” by giving schoolchildren free meals 365 days a year. The council has cited national research which suggests almost one third of parents who are earning less than £25,000 skip some meals during school holidays to feed their children. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux separate</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Actors Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux have announced that they separated late last year, seven years after meeting on the set of Wanderlust. The couple were married in August 2015 and do not have children. In a joint statement, they said they were speaking publicly because the “gossip industry” would otherwise “speculate and invent”. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Kim Jong-un impersonator shocks North Koreans</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The Winter Olympics in South Korea received a surprise guest yesterday, who seemed at first to be North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un. An impersonator who gave his name as Howard and said he was Australian, the interloper posed in front of the North Korean cheerleading squad, shocking them into silence, before he was thrown out. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Briefing: US gun violence in six chilling statistics</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Of the 49 months since January 2014, only six have passed without at least one instance of gun violence in a US school. And between 2014 and 2017, shootings claimed the lives of 2,710 children under the age of 12.</p>
<p>Those are just two of the takeaways from the chilling statistics compiled by the Gun Violence Archive, a charity that tracks shooting incidents in the US. </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/91679/us-gun-violence-in-six-chilling-statistics">US gun violence in six chilling statistics</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>
